messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: What Unschooling Looks Like?!
messages.msgSnippet: WOW it sounds awesome, and inspiring.....but it is right when we are going mad here (our strawberry farm) with our to do list!!!  I then thought, we could
messages.messageBody:
WOW it sounds awesome, and inspiring.....but it is right when we are
going mad here (our strawberry farm) with our "to do" list!!! I then
thought, we could plan for next year, but of course it's on the other
side of the continent.......the NEXT year perhaps!!??

Louisa

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: What Unschooling Looks Like?!
messages.msgSnippet: Louisa, I just looked at your website and my mouth is watering at the strawberry pictures!  Then I saw that your farm is on Vancouver Island and I wondered if
messages.messageBody:
Louisa,
I just looked at your website and my mouth is watering at the strawberry
pictures! Then I saw that your farm is on Vancouver Island and I wondered
if you already knew about the upcoming LIFE is Good unschooling conference
that is south of you in Vancouver, Washington?
http://www.lifeisgoodconference.com/

Though it conflicts with strawberry season..?
-Jenny Canfield

messages.subject: Re: What Unschooling Looks Like?!
messages.msgSnippet: August is smarter than so many doctors who told moms they should bottle feed so they d know how much the baby drank.  You can weigh the baby before and after
messages.messageBody:
August is smarter than so many doctors who told moms they should
bottle feed so they'd know how much the baby drank. You can weigh the
baby before and after breastfeeding. Doctors and nurses couldn't
figure that out and a six year old boy did? Well there y'go. <g>

Sandra

messages.subject: What Unschooling Looks Like?!
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Everyone, This is my first post, but I ve been reading for awhile.  I ve always had Sandra s website on my favourites (and been reading it for a couple of
messages.messageBody:
Hi Everyone,

This is my first post, but I've been reading for awhile. I've always
had Sandra's website on my favourites (and been reading it for a
couple of years) and read all John Holt's books. My oldest went to
Kindergarten (long story) and now is at home for grade one......and I
tried "structured unschooling" using project based stuff, but find
even that turns him off so I've backed off and now just try and read
read read to him and we do "experiments" (science type activities I
glean from books and internet around things I hear my boys (6,4 and 2)
interested in........ )

EEEeeeeeaaaaanyways, I'm sure I read this original post here and I had
to laugh the other morning when August (6 year old) ran into the
kitchen naked (and our house is COLD in the morning) and said "guess
what?! My pee pee weighs half a pound!!!! do you know how I know????
I weighed myself before I peed and then after!!!!!" and then until he
noticed it was cold he talked about how much his jammies weighed
too.......and finally went and got some clothes on........

Louisa,
mum to August 6, Sawyer 4 and Holden 2
